com.frdfsnlght.transporter.api

Interface RemoteServer


  • public interface RemoteServer
    Represents a locally configured server that the plugin connects to.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void broadcast(Callback<java.lang.Integer> cb, java.lang.String message, java.lang.String permission)
      Broadcasts a message to all players on the remote server with the specified permission.
      void broadcastMessage(Callback<java.lang.Integer> cb, java.lang.String message)
      Broadcasts a message to all players on the remote server.
      void dispatchCommand(Callback<java.lang.Boolean> cb, org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, java.lang.String commandLine)
      Executes a command on the remote server.
      boolean getAllowRemoteCommands()
      Returns the value of the "allowRemoteCommands" option.
      boolean getAnnouncePlayers()
      Returns the value of the "announcePlayers" option.
      java.lang.String getChatFormat()
      Returns the value of the "chatFormat" option.
      void getDefaultGameMode(Callback<org.bukkit.GameMode> cb)
      Returns the configured default game mode on the remote server.
      java.lang.String getKey()
      Returns the locally configured key for this server.
      java.lang.String getKickMessage(java.net.InetSocketAddress clientAddress)
      Returns the message used to kick the player with the specified address and reconnect them to this server when the transfer method is ClientKick.

      Returns the value of the "mExecTarget" option.

      Returns the name of server.

      Returns the value of the "receiveChat" option.

      Returns the value of the "receiveChatFilter" option.
      RemoteGate getRemoteGate(java.lang.String gateName)
      Returns a RemoteGate object for the specified gate, or null if the gate doesn't exist.
      java.util.Set<RemoteGate> getRemoteGates()
      Returns a set of gates on the server.
      java.util.Set<RemotePlayer> getRemotePlayers()
      Returns a set of players currently online on the server.

      Returns a RemoteWorld object for the specified world, or null if the world doesn't exist.

      Returns a set of worlds on the server.

      Returns the value of the "sendChat" option.

      Returns the Id of the remote server.

      Returns the method used to transfer players to this server.

      Returns the version of the remote server.

      Returns true if the server is currently connected.

        clientAddress -
        Returns:
        the kick message, or null if there's a problem

      • getName

        void getName(Callback<java.lang.String> cb)
        Returns the configured name of the remote server.

        This method returns the name of the remote server as configured in that server's properties file.
